abstract: Former French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy's conservative Union for a Popular Movement party rebrands itself as the Republicans, name whose nationalistic allusions show extent to which the far-right National Front party is influencing politics there; analysts say Sarkozy intends to co-opt some of appeal and policy positions of National Front in effort to draw right-wing voters.
lead_paragraph: In adopting a name that plays to French nationalism, the party led by former President Nicolas Sarkozy is offering the latest evidence of the ways in which the far-right National Front is reshaping politics.

headline.main: In France, a Party’s Name Change Tracks a Drift to the Right in Europe
headline.print_headline: In France, a Party’s Name Change Tracks a Drift to the Right in Europe

snippet: In adopting a name that plays to French nationalism, the party led by former President Nicolas Sarkozy is offering the latest evidence of the ways in which the far-right National Front is reshaping politics.
